Sentencas: Composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells were modeled by three-dimensional resistor networks.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The networks were generated on a computer by identifying neighbors in either cubic lattices randomly occupied by electrolyte or electrode particles, or in random packings generated by sequential deposition of such particles in random order.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The resistance between any two particle sites i and j were taken to be functions of the conductivities of the particles residing in site i and j and the periphery of the necks formed between them.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An emphasis was put on parameters believed to be relevant for cermets of Ni and yttria-stabilized zirconia.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The conductivity df the networks were calculated numerically, and the results of the model are in good agreement with experimental findings.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A sharp transition from low to high conductivity occurs at approximately 30 volume percent of electrode material for cubic lattices and for the random packings with uniform particle radii.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the bimodal random packings, this percolation threshold increases with increasing electrode-particle radius relative to the electrolyte-particle radius.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This is suggested as a possible explanation for cermet deactivation under operation, since upon aggregation of electrode particles the percolation threshold may increase past the given volume fraction of electrode material in the composite.
Titulo: Monte Carlo simulations of conductivity of composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells
